page.title: 17Attitudes to Sheering
page.content: Most people seem to like living in {Sheering}and find the village a friendly place. They are especially fond of their houses. They think the village is usually quiet,but they find the main street busy with all the traffic especially between 8 and 9 o'clock in the morning and 5 and 6 o'clock in the evening. Most people find the village shops useful but do their bulk shopping in{Harlow}or {Bishop's Stortford. }One newcomer to the village pointed out the importance of owning a car because of the limited bus service. Without a car it is difficult for people to visit the theatre or cinema because of the high cost of taxis.If a member of the family is ill it is difficult to go to a Doctor's surgery unless you own a car,although other villagers are extremely helpful in times of trouble.
